review_title: Oxford has a long term employee with me !
job_title: Home Health Caregiver/CNA in Tulsa, OK
pros: Not only are they flexible w/ hours, they have some of the best leaders you could ask for at a work establishment!
cons: Only downside is when you have a regular client you're assigned to and they unexpectedly pass causing you to go back to picking up shifts that are available. Needless to say they find u another perm very quickly

job_title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) in Tulsa, OK
pros: I have received at least 80% of my paychecks. So there's that.
cons: I got very little communication at the beginning. They didn't even give me a start date. I finally called and they said I could've began 2 weeks ago. Now 6 months in they are telling me I was supposed to work a different schedule all this time. This is one of the most unorganized companies I've ever worked for.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Joplin, MO
pros: Valuable service for the elderly.
cons: Directions to clients home not accurate

job_title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) in Jackson, MS
pros: Like and good will recommend to anyone
cons: Neither dislike and or like

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Hartford, CT
pros: Nice, decent people to work with
cons: It's 2021 and this company refuses to offer paperless statements.  I received many calls from customers wondering why they couldn't switch to a paperless option. In this day in age we all have to be conscious of the environment and stop cutting down trees. As an environmentally conscious individual I had to make to decision to leave.

pros: Great company to work for, very flexible and easy going especially when it comes to accommodating employees in college. Very nice employees and they’re very professional.
cons: No cons for this company

pros: Culture, team work and caring
cons: No cons to think of

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Jackson, MS
pros: The schedules are very Flexible
cons: The managers can be very Rude

job_title: Personal Care Assistant in Mobile, AL
pros: Its a great stepping stone to start off in the medical field. I've worked here for 5 years and had my great days and my bad days, but what truly made me continue to work there all those years was the appreciation of all my clients and doing something that I loved. I would recommend working here to get a kick start of your career, however there is room for growth in other areas as well.
cons: The only problem that I had with this company (Mobile location) is that they didn't give raises or bonuses and some of the staff was very lazy, unorganized and unprofessional at times.

job_title: Home Health Aide in Columbia, MO
pros:
I have worked here over a year now, been threw some changes for the better.  
I love how I can make my own schudual. Having kids it’s amazing when something happens I call the office and my clients and reschedule!! 
Work hard and you can move up in the company easily depending on location
cons:
The pay.  I was offered $11 40 hour week with insurance.  It was very tempting but the making my own schudual was the only thing  that kept me from taking the offered job from a past manager
Some weeks are great with hours but some weeks with ice and snow and clients going into the hospital it’s super hard.  Single moms can’t live off this income.  We need better pay.

pros: Flexible schedules and a family oriented atmosphere.
cons: The company often look outside of its corporate walls for management when there are qualified individuals within the company.  They should have their administrative staff to update education and training annually and pull from those files for placement to new positions.

pros: I have worked at Oxford HealthCare for 18 years.  I have found Oxford to be a very progressive company always looking for ways to meet the needs of clients and their families.  Always working on ways to keep the client in their own home which is where they prefer to be.  I have found Management to always be approachable with any questions or suggestions that I have had.  I have and will continue to tell everyone that I think Oxford is a Great place to work but most of all a Great place to have your family taken care of.
cons: I do not have any cons

job_title: Office Care Manager/Social Services, Home Health Aide in Cullman, AL
pros: Getting to know he clients.  Assisting so they may remain in their own homes and avoiding nursing home placement.
cons: Scheduling is an issue at times.  Have been sent to a home where another worker is already present.  Sending me on the wrong day.  No mileage is paid.

pros: Great coworkers with a supportive system in place to help case managers succeed.  Most of the employees have been with the company for many years.
cons: As with any healthcare position - too much paperwork, but that seems to be the case everywhere.  It is a lot to learn, but once there is an understanding of the position it is very hard to go anywhere else.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Springfield, MO
pros: At Oxford we have great staff support for the field nurses.  My clinical manager is WONDERFUL.  Michelle Clayton is very supportive and caring and I am thrilled to be on her team. I am proud to work at Oxford.
cons: We don't get to see everyone often enough so it is hard to create strong work relationships with our peers.

pros: I have worked for Oxford HealthCare for two years and enjoy the flexible scheduling they offer to allow me to balance my family needs with work.  The supervisors and professional and supportive.  I have had opportunities to develop my skills and take on more tasks.  I love working here!
cons: No significant dislikes or problems over the last two years with Oxford HealthCare.

pros: Excellent director, great co-workers, not for profit, no pressure to commit fraud, very respectful of employees, very positive place
cons: The only con I can think of is an odd way of determining pay which is probably fair but complicated.

pros: Oxford management is always striving to improve client and employee experience to ensure excellent and consistent services.  I feel valued!
cons: Oxford's benefits are competitive. Oxford is not a for profit company, so I believe they go above and beyond to give employees the best pay and benefits possible, while ensuring a solid foundation for longevity.

review_title: I have worked at OXF for 24 years and it is an amazing company.
pros: Job Security, Nursing and Therapy autonomy, up to date technology, innovative, very positive working environment and excellent Managers that are always there for field staf.
cons: None that I know of.

review_title: Work Experience as Private Duty Nurse
pros: If you don't mind that there are no benefits paid to private duty nurses, you can enjoy some autonomy  being on your own to schedule your day.
cons: Family members will insist on the nurse to be in sight of the camera with client care at all times, so they can watch remotely, very awkward and restrictive......also no benefits paid. Management tends to side with family members with issues of client care.

pros: I can not say. I have yet to have a client with them.
cons: I have been working with this company for 6 months. I still have not had one client. The one client they actually gave me was for 2 hours for one day. (It was suppose to be filling in for another worker) when I came to actually see the client another worker was there. No mileage was paid all I got was a simple sorry.

pros: They are very good with working around your schedule epically if you have kids or school. You can either choose or deny to take on clients. No pressure.
cons: Pay is very low compared to other companies in town

pros: Oxford provides amazing services that help keep people of all ages at home and as independent as possible - for as long as possible!  The team that I work with is awesome.  Very caring and innovative!
cons: We need more staff to provide care to individuals who need us!

job_title: In Home Aide in Springfield, MO
pros: Work one on one with clients with little supervision. Flexible schedules. Paid .30 mile to travel from client to client
cons: No advancement opportunity, low pay for very hard work, have to ask for days off over a month in advance, mileage pay is too low.

pros: I've worked here almost 20 years.  Great people to work with and for.  Very caring and I've had great opportunities for growth along the way! It's great to help people stay in their home as long as possible.
cons: Nothing negative at this time

pros: The work this company does is very meaningful, you help a lot of patients with disabilities.
cons: A lot of micro-management happens, upper management doesn't always communicate with staff about changes or upcoming projects.

pros: Relatively low-stress job, with great clients.
cons: No training. Not enough hours. They give you hours based on availability of clients. That's all fine and dandy, however I did not make enough for the amount of work to continue sustaining myself.

pros: Nice Supervisor , good people to work with. The clients are sweet and nice
cons: The pay is not all that good. Not enough hours to make ends meet

pros: Made your own schedule clients were great loved the errands you could work for federal or state or both  that was awesome. ...
cons: If you didn't get your time card right you didn't get paid....

pros: Great benefits, great management, great office atmosphere, organized atmosphere
cons: Moderate level of communication issues, a bit of ongoing gossip, building outdated, understaffed in some departments, low pay

pros: They  care someone always to help out
cons: Some time  don't get 40 hrs on in home side
